column4: so i took my boot disk and put it on the motherboard ide slot
but still no dice
well
i made sure to build all the drivers i needed into the kernel
but
kernel panics nonetheless
apparently anything pci express ?
here's my specs: athlon 64 venice core, asus k8v-e deluxe mobo, radeon x1800xt, sil 0680 pci raid host controller with a striped set (that's windows though), 2 maxtor drives on the mobo ide bus
erm, i also have a firewire soundcard, but i'm not worrying about that at this point...
i'm upset that it installed drivers for my freaking webcam but i can't seem to get it to read the hard disks correctly
what in particular is not working?
you need to take ten steps back and tell us what on earth is going on
is some piece of hardware not working?
in what way is it not working? what do you think it should be doing?
when using the default ubuntu kernel?
then use the ubuntu default, and tell us what happens
does lspci list the device?
so boot back into the ubuntu kernel
uh, go find a boot cd
alt-f2
and you're hitting alt-f2 when?
then boot the installer
you need to mount them, I have no idea what device your / was
perhaps those modules aren't loaded until you get the partitioning stage of the installer
